instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Need clean ME region Bios
threads.message:
Hello,

I have that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which looks perfect, absolutely clean, pulsing but would not start.
I was planning to give it a clean using the ultrasonic cleaner but before that I thought, let's check with another Bios.
I did try a Bios I've found on vinafix and it did start but bad ME region. Progress bar stuck at the end.

I am providing the original Bios that I could dump but I  guess it is messed up for some reasons so if someone could provide a nice clean Bios for that board model, that would help.
Thanks.
[url]https://www.dropbox.com/s/46s2wsm206bbpju/ST1857_2.8Ghz_8GB_2014_read1.BIN?dl=0[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Need clean ME region Bios
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Need clean ME region Bios
threads.message:
Actually, I need to give an update on that one...
As soon as we did boot from the internal flash drive, we saw Windows blue screen asking to press F1 or F8 talking about some file.EFI
Once we tried to restart same problem happened again... it wouldn't start.
It reminds me once I did boot on a drive which had the chameleon boot loader (used for hackintosh), same problem, board was dead.

Something must be erasing or rewriting the EFI part of the bios somehow. In this case some windows boot file.
